page.title: 16Visit to Withington Hospital
page.content: On Tuesday 25th June a group of fourteen children from our class went on a visit to the hospital. We were taken around the hospital by a Miss June Isherwood, Personnel Officer. We went to the old Workhouse Chapel which is now used as a store, but it will eventually be made into a conference hall. The chapel, we discovered, is a listed building which means that it is of historical value and cannot be knocked down. From the chapel we walked down the main corridor of the hospital. It is 3/4 mile long. At the end was the Maternity Unit where we met a Nursing Officer called Mrs.Durkin. She explained to us the daily role of a nurse or midwife. She took us to the Delivery Suite where we saw a baby girl only ten minutes old. The father told us his wife would call it Lyndsay
